title: (x) "fun" Mexico font - various {gang}
content:
Greetings fellow type lovers. Seeking recommendations for a font that says "fun Mexico" that isn't Fajita. Anybody got any ideas?   
   
AHL
author: ahleman

comments.content: Andrew, just wanted to say I love Satisfaction, Penitentiary Gothic and your site. Thanks for putting up those pdfs of your props. Please continue sharing those pdfs with us. I love it when I can examine something up close that was on screen for just a second. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

sweet stuff Andrew!   
   
I'll be the thousandth person to say it, but,   
major props!   
   
   
bj

Thanks very much for the extremely helpful suggestions and the very kind words! Much appreciated.   
   
AHL

[Neuland](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neuland/) (or [Nueland](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/koch-nueland/)) might work in a pinch. Letraset's [Arriba](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/arriba/) also comes to mind.   
   
As for Image Club faces (besides the aforementioned Fajita) you could try the Chilada family: [Uno](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.imageclub.com/font/405825), [Dos](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.imageclub.com/font/405826), [Tres](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.imageclub.com/font/405827) & [Cuatro](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.imageclub.com/font/405828)

That Penitentiary font should solve all those license plate queries once and for all!   
   
You could also try the somewhat used and abused [Remedy](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224332/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PRemD.html)
